column4: hi all, i have a problem, i done a fresh install of dapper and cannot get my wifi to work. it's a WPC54G V3 (im using https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/WirelessCardsSupported as a reference)
and i still can't get my wifi working.
(built in driver works flawlessly with the 2.6.15 kernel, ndiswrapper not needed. Do not know if it will work for install.)
who isn't, here?
im using V3
lol Plouj :)
yes cyanics
but it says this next to the card
(built in driver works flawlessly with the 2.6.15 kernel, ndiswrapper not needed. Do not know if it will work for install.)
do i _have_ to use WEP (or whatever) ubuntu has standard
says my session ID is invalid
when i try to config the wifi settings
thanks |thun-afk :)
i just have this problem, i'm used to using WPA, and i'm not at all familiar with WEP or ubuntu
and i'm not 100% my card will even work with ubuntu
cause i use iwconfig and it says i have a broadcome/ airforce1 chipset
yet it's a linksys wpc54g v3
wap/wep isn't different to the end user except for security reasons
ok..
driven?
